Because @SenateGOP uses an arcane, Jim Crow era relic to stop the will of a democratically elected majority #EndTheFilibuster
The filibuster allows a minority of Senators to prevent overwhelmingly popular legislation from becoming law. It is undemocratic and must be abolished #EndTheFilibuster

Now, the filibuster is being used by Senate Republicans to prevent:

- Meaningful action on climate change

- Voting rights legislation

- Steps to curb gun violence

In 1917, the filibuster was first used by white supremacists to prevent a bill that would have made lynching a crime. In the Jim Crow era, the filibuster was only used to block civil rights legislation.

The rules in the Senate are the same as they are in the House. In order to pass a bill, a simple majority must vote in favor of the bill.
 
Where the Senate differs is that, with the filibuster, you need a supermajority to even bring a bill to a vote.
It’s time to #EndTheFilibuster. It’s an arcane, Jim Crow era relic that is preventing a democratically elected majority from passing overwhelmingly popular legislation on a range of issues.

Republicans proposed at least 250 voting restriction laws at the state level. Georgia has already passed a voter suppression bill.

H.R. 1 is waiting to be passed in the Senate & it would protect our right to vote. 

This is an urgent crisis. We must #EndTheFilibuster & pass it.

Making Washington, D.C. a state requires a constitutional amendment and requires overturning the 23rd Amendment, not a mere statute like H.R. 51. The Democrats’ blatant disregard for the Constitution is on full display for the American people to see.

In establishing Washington, D.C. as our nation’s capital, our Framers never intended that the seat of the federal government be a state. Dems’ H.R. 51 undermines critical aspects of our founding in favor of their partisan agenda.

Under H.R. 51, Democrat DC Mayor Muriel Bowser would become governor, but the past year has been proof that she can barely run Washington, D.C. as a city. Turning Washington, D.C. into a state would end up being an unmitigated policy disaster.

Democrats’ push for D.C. statehood is really about Democrats’ desperation for power. With Democrats’ narrow majority in Congress, this is just an attempt to stack the U.S. Senate in their favor and maintain their control over the American people.

Answer: All they want is one-party rule and total control.

Rail is a more efficient use of land than highways and it's cheaper, faster and safer than driving.

Not only will high-speed rail transform transportation, but it’s also good for the environment. How? We can power it with clean electricity, providing a low-carbon alternative for intercity travel that’s cleaner and cheaper than flying with no weather delays.

Electric vehicles are a part of the solution, but why put more cars on the road all to have them sit in the same traffic, while we continue to pay billions to fill potholes, repair roads and bridges? It’s time for something different: high-speed rail.
